trans-unit.source: Securely Connecting to BackEnd Resources from an App Service Environment
trans-unit.target: Securely Connecting to BackEnd Resources from an App Service Environment

trans-unit.source: Learn about how to securely connect to backend resources from an App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: Learn about how to securely connect to backend resources from an App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: Securely Connecting to Backend Resources from an App Service Environment
trans-unit.target: Securely Connecting to Backend Resources from an App Service Environment

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Since an App Service Environment is always created in a subnet of a regional <link><linkText>virtual network[virtualnetwork]</linkText><title></title></link>, outbound connections from an App Service Environment to other backend resources can flow exclusively over the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Since an App Service Environment is always created in a subnet of a regional <link><linkText>virtual network[virtualnetwork]</linkText><title></title></link>, outbound connections from an App Service Environment to other backend resources can flow exclusively over the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: For example, there may be a SQL Server running on a cluster of virtual machines with port 1433 locked down.
trans-unit.target: For example, there may be a SQL Server running on a cluster of virtual machines with port 1433 locked down.

trans-unit.source: The endpoint may be ACLd to only allow access from other resources on the same virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The endpoint may be ACLd to only allow access from other resources on the same virtual network.

trans-unit.source: As another example, sensitive endpoints may run on-premises and be connected to Azure via either <link><linkText>Site-to-Site[sitetosite]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Azure ExpressRoute[expressroute]</linkText><title></title></link> connections.
trans-unit.target: As another example, sensitive endpoints may run on-premises and be connected to Azure via either <link><linkText>Site-to-Site[sitetosite]</linkText><title></title></link> or <link><linkText>Azure ExpressRoute[expressroute]</linkText><title></title></link> connections.

trans-unit.source: As a result, only resources in virtual networks connected to the Site-to-Site or ExpressRoute tunnels will be able to access on-premises endpoints.
trans-unit.target: As a result, only resources in virtual networks connected to the Site-to-Site or ExpressRoute tunnels will be able to access on-premises endpoints.

trans-unit.source: For all of these scenarios, apps running on an App Service Environment will be able to securely connect to the various servers and resources.
trans-unit.target: For all of these scenarios, apps running on an App Service Environment will be able to securely connect to the various servers and resources.

trans-unit.source: Outbound traffic from apps running in an App Service Environment to private endpoints in the same virtual network (or connected to the same virtual network), will only flow over the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Outbound traffic from apps running in an App Service Environment to private endpoints in the same virtual network (or connected to the same virtual network), will only flow over the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: Outbound traffic to private endpoints will not flow over the public Internet.
trans-unit.target: Outbound traffic to private endpoints will not flow over the public Internet.

trans-unit.source: Outbound Connectivity and DNS Requirements
trans-unit.target: Outbound Connectivity and DNS Requirements

trans-unit.source: Note that for an App Service Environment to function properly, it requires outbound access to Azure Storage as well as Sql Database in the same Azure region.
trans-unit.target: Note that for an App Service Environment to function properly, it requires outbound access to Azure Storage as well as Sql Database in the same Azure region.

trans-unit.source: If outbound Internet access is blocked in the virtual network, App Service Environments will not be able to access these Azure endpoints.
trans-unit.target: If outbound Internet access is blocked in the virtual network, App Service Environments will not be able to access these Azure endpoints.

trans-unit.source: Customer may also have custom DNS servers configured in the virtual network.
trans-unit.target: Customer may also have custom DNS servers configured in the virtual network.

trans-unit.source: App Service Environments need to be able to resolve Azure endpoints under *.database.windows.net, *.file.core.windows.net and *.blob.core.windows.net.
trans-unit.target: App Service Environments need to be able to resolve Azure endpoints under *.database.windows.net, *.file.core.windows.net and *.blob.core.windows.net.

trans-unit.source: It is also recommended that any custom DNS servers on the virtual network be setup ahead of time prior to creating an App Service Environment.
trans-unit.target: It is also recommended that any custom DNS servers on the virtual network be setup ahead of time prior to creating an App Service Environment.

trans-unit.source: If a virtual network's DNS configuration is changed while an App Service Environment is being created, that will result in the App Service Environment creation process failing.
trans-unit.target: If a virtual network's DNS configuration is changed while an App Service Environment is being created, that will result in the App Service Environment creation process failing.

trans-unit.source: Connecting to a SQL Server
trans-unit.target: Connecting to a SQL Server

trans-unit.source: A common SQL Server configuration has an endpoint listening on port 1433:
trans-unit.target: A common SQL Server configuration has an endpoint listening on port 1433:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>SQL Server Endpoint</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>SQL Server Endpoint</linkText>

trans-unit.source: There are two approaches for restricting traffic to this endpoint:
trans-unit.target: There are two approaches for restricting traffic to this endpoint:

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Network Access Control Lists[networkaccesscontrollists]</linkText><title></title></link> (Network ACLs)
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Network Access Control Lists[networkaccesscontrollists]</linkText><title></title></link> (Network ACLs)

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Network Security Groups[networksecuritygroups]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Network Security Groups[networksecuritygroups]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: Restricting Access With a Network ACL
trans-unit.target: Restricting Access With a Network ACL

trans-unit.source: Port 1433 can be secured using a network access control list.
trans-unit.target: Port 1433 can be secured using a network access control list.

trans-unit.source: The example below whitelists client addresses originating from inside of a virtual network, and blocks access to all other clients.
trans-unit.target: The example below whitelists client addresses originating from inside of a virtual network, and blocks access to all other clients.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Network Access Control List Example</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Network Access Control List Example</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Any applications running in App Service Environment in the same virtual network as the SQL Server will be able to connect to the SQL Server instance using the VNet internal IP address for the SQL Server virtual machine.
trans-unit.target: Any applications running in App Service Environment in the same virtual network as the SQL Server will be able to connect to the SQL Server instance using the VNet internal IP address for the SQL Server virtual machine.

trans-unit.source: The example connection string below references the SQL Server using its private IP address.
trans-unit.target: The example connection string below references the SQL Server using its private IP address.

trans-unit.source: Although the virtual machine has a public endpoint as well, connection attempts using the public IP address will be rejected because of the network ACL.
trans-unit.target: Although the virtual machine has a public endpoint as well, connection attempts using the public IP address will be rejected because of the network ACL.

trans-unit.source: Restricting Access With a Network Security Group
trans-unit.target: Restricting Access With a Network Security Group

trans-unit.source: An alternative approach for securing access is with a network security group.
trans-unit.target: An alternative approach for securing access is with a network security group.

trans-unit.source: Network security groups can be applied to individual virtual machines, or to a subnet containing virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: Network security groups can be applied to individual virtual machines, or to a subnet containing virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: First a network security group needs to be created:
trans-unit.target: First a network security group needs to be created:

trans-unit.source: Restricting access to only VNet internal traffic is very simple with a network security group.
trans-unit.target: Restricting access to only VNet internal traffic is very simple with a network security group.

trans-unit.source: The default rules in a network security group only allow access from other network clients in the same virtual network.
trans-unit.target: The default rules in a network security group only allow access from other network clients in the same virtual network.

trans-unit.source: As a result locking down access to SQL Server is as simple as applying a network security group with its default rules to either the virtual machines running SQL Server, or the subnet containing the virtual machines.
trans-unit.target: As a result locking down access to SQL Server is as simple as applying a network security group with its default rules to either the virtual machines running SQL Server, or the subnet containing the virtual machines.

trans-unit.source: The sample below applies a network security group to the containing subnet:
trans-unit.target: The sample below applies a network security group to the containing subnet:

trans-unit.source: The end result is a set of security rules that block external access, while allowing VNet internal access:
trans-unit.target: The end result is a set of security rules that block external access, while allowing VNet internal access:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Default Network Security Rules</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Default Network Security Rules</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Getting started
trans-unit.target: Getting started

trans-unit.source: To get started with App Service Environments, see <link><linkText>Introduction to App Service Environment[introtoappserviceenvironment]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: To get started with App Service Environments, see <link><linkText>Introduction to App Service Environment[introtoappserviceenvironment]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: For details around controlling inbound traffic to your App Service Environment, see <link><linkText>Controlling inbound traffic to an App Service Environment[controlinboundase]</linkText><title></title></link>
trans-unit.target: For details around controlling inbound traffic to your App Service Environment, see <link><linkText>Controlling inbound traffic to an App Service Environment[controlinboundase]</linkText><title></title></link>

trans-unit.source: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see <link><linkText>Azure App Service[azureappservice]</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about the Azure App Service platform, see <link><linkText>Azure App Service[azureappservice]</linkText><title></title></link>.
